summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to UBS Financial Services, Inc., demanding extensive financial records related to Ghislaine Maxwell and several associated entities. The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felonies including sex trafficking and related offenses, and includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as an individual for whom all financial records are to be produced from UBS accounts, indicating she is a central subject of the grand jury investigation.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is authorizing the grand jury investigation and subpoena targeting Maxwell's financial records.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The date by which UBS Financial Services is commanded to appear before the grand jury or produce the requested records.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The date the grand jury subpoena was issued and signed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman.

locations: UBS Financial Services, Inc., 1000 Harbor Blvd 8th Floor, Weehawken, NJ 07086
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY 10278 (FBI office)
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felonies including violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), 2422(b) (coercion and enticement), and 371 (conspiracy).

Ghislaine Maxwell is explicitly named as a target of the investigation, with the subpoena demanding all financial records related to her and several associated entities (Terramar Project Inc., Ellmax LLC, Max Foundation, Max Hotel Services Corp).
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested UBS to voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

The subpoena demands an extremely broad range of financial records, including wire transfers, credit card statements, safe deposit records, online banking information, and all correspondence related to the accounts.
The document demonstrates an active federal grand jury investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell's financial activities in August 2019, prior to her arrest in July 2020.
